message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<User> it = listUser.iterator();
while(it.hasNext()){
    User user = it.next();
    System.out.println(count + ":" + user.getFirstname()+" "+ user.getLastname());
    count++;
    it.remove();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The reason why you're not getting a ConcurrentModificationException is because you're only iterating through the list once before modifying it. The ConcurrentModificationException is thrown when you try to modify a collection while iterating over it in a loop. In your case, you're removing the current element from the list inside the loop, which is not allowed. Instead, you should use an Iterator and its remove method to safely remove elements during iteration.
